Interface BalanceCheckerInterface

public interface BalanceCheckerInterface
Interface for HW 08, Balanced Checker

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addPair​(java.lang.Character open, java.lang.Character close)
    Adds a pair of matching characters.
    boolean isBalanced​(java.lang.String s)
    Checks the given string and uses the pairs of symbols previously added with addPair to see if the string has balanced symbols.
    boolean isClosing​(java.lang.Character ch)
    Checks to see if the given character has been added as a closing character.
    boolean isOpening​(java.lang.Character ch)
    Checks to see if the given character has been added as an opening character.
    boolean match​(java.lang.Character ch1, java.lang.Character ch2)
    Returns true if the two given characters are a pair of matching characters that have been previously added with the addPair method.

  • Method Details

    • addPair

      void addPair​(java.lang.Character open, java.lang.Character close) throws DuplicateCharacterException
      Adds a pair of matching characters. For example '(' matches with ')' and '{' matches with '}'.
      Parameters:
      open - An opening character
      close - The corresponding closing character
      Throws:
      DuplicateCharacterException - if either character has already been added.

    • isBalanced

      boolean isBalanced​(java.lang.String s)
      Checks the given string and uses the pairs of symbols previously added with addPair to see if the string has balanced symbols. If the string does have balanced symbols, this method returns true, otherwise it returns false. If no pairs have been added, the string is considered to be balanced.
      Parameters:
      s - The string to be checked for balanced symbols
      Returns:
      true if the string s has balanced symbols, returns false otherwise

    • isOpening

      boolean isOpening​(java.lang.Character ch)
      Checks to see if the given character has been added as an opening character.
      Parameters:
      ch - The symbol to check
      Returns:
      true if the given character has been added as an opening character, returns false otherwise.

    • isClosing

      boolean isClosing​(java.lang.Character ch)
      Checks to see if the given character has been added as a closing character.
      Parameters:
      ch - The symbol to check
      Returns:
      true if the given character has been added as a closing character, returns false otherwise.

    • match

      boolean match​(java.lang.Character ch1, java.lang.Character ch2)
      Returns true if the two given characters are a pair of matching characters that have been previously added with the addPair method. The first symbol is assumed to be an opening character. The method returns true if the second character is the closing character that corresponds to the first.
      Parameters:
      ch1 - The first character to check
      ch2 - The second character to check
      Returns:
      true if the symbols are a matching pair that has been previously added with the addPair method.
